meanings.definition: The quality or state of being communicable.
meanings.sent1: The communicability of the virus made it spread quickly through the community.
meanings.sent2: Effective communication relies on the communicability of ideas between people.
meanings.sent3: The communicability of laughter in the room was contagious, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The communicability of joy in her voice brightened up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The communicability of kindness can create a ripple effect of positivity.

meanings.definition: The ability to be transmitted from one person to another.
meanings.sent1: The communicability of the flu led to many people getting sick.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the communicability of emotions can improve relationships.
meanings.sent3: The communicability of gossip in the office was like a game of telephone.
meanings.sent4: The communicability of enthusiasm in the team meeting was inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The communicability of fear can spread rapidly in a crowd.
